abstract: Microsoft has made a complex proposal that would involve collaboration in the online advertising business but would not involve a full takeover, the company said on Sunday.
snippet: Microsoft has made a complex proposal that would involve collaboration in the online advertising business but would not involve a full takeover, the company said on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has proposed a complex new deal with Yahoo that would involve collaboration between their online advertising businesses but would not involve a full takeover, Microsoft said on Sunday.

headline.main: In Reversal, Microsoft Proposes New Deal to Yahoo

abstract: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
snippet: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google  and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.

headline.main: Pursuit of Yahoo Shows Microsoft Needs a Franchise
headline.print_headline: Pursuing Yahoo Again, Microsoft Shows Need for a Web Franchise

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Steve Lohr

abstract: Facebook founder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg stressed the company’s independence on Monday, after a report the Website might be sold to Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Facebook founder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg stressed the company’s independence on Monday, after a report the Website might be sold to Microsoft.

headline.main: Zuckerberg Says Facebook Wants to Stay Independent

abstract: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google – and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google – and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.

abstract: Now that Microsoft has resumed its amorous pursuit of Yahoo — ostensibly seeking less than a full takeover deal this time — it could be a good time to review some of the steps taken in the contest and our thinking throughout:
lead_paragraph: Now that Microsoft has resumed its amorous pursuit of Yahoo — ostensibly seeking less than a full takeover deal this time — it could be a good time to review some of the steps taken in the contest and our thinking throughout:

abstract: Yahoo wants Google’s cash now and Microsoft’s share of the search business for the long run. It might be well served to do deals with both of them.
snippet: Yahoo wants Google’s cash now and Microsoft’s share of the search business for the long run. It might be well served to do deals with both of them.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo might well be able to have its Google cake and eat Microsoft’s market share, too.

headline.main: Google or Microsoft: Yahoo Should Pick Both

abstract: Microsoft‘s latest overture to Yahoo has raised a lot of questions about what exactly it wants from the new round of negotiations. What we do know for sure from the statement it issued Sunday is that Microsoft isn’t currently pursuing an acquisition of all of Yahoo. That leaves all kinds of other possibilities, including joint ventures, partnerships or a deal to acquire just a piece of Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft‘s latest overture to Yahoo has raised a lot of questions about what exactly it wants from the new round of negotiations. What we do know for sure from the statement it issued Sunday is that Microsoft isn’t currently pursuing an acquisition of all of Yahoo. That leaves all kinds of other possibilities, including joint ventures, partnerships or a deal to acquire just a piece of Yahoo.

abstract: While there’s no denying that Xbox 360 is the first to sell the 10 million consoles, it isn’t going to hold the bragging rights for much longer.
snippet: While there’s no denying that Xbox 360 is the first to sell the 10 million consoles, it isn’t going to hold the bragging rights for much longer.
lead_paragraph: According to Microsoft, the Xbox 360 just hit a major milestone: it has become the first of the new generation of video game consoles to sell more than 10 million units in the United States (It’s up to 10.09 million, according to figures from NPD Group). A Microsoft news release crows that it continues to outsell Sony’s PlayStation 3.

headline.main: And the Winner of the Game Console Wars Is….
